nodes.bodyText: Since there are lot of cases let's use a switch case

Shall we use something like getNumericLiteralKind as the name?
Le'ts use a switch case here also
we need to do this check inside the parseStringContent().

if the syntaxkind is DOUBLE_QUOTE_TOKEN then return STNodeFactory.createEmptyNode();
Also need to fix recovery for this method with above change
why we need this? what happens to the consumed token in L573?

We only use newlines for validation. Ex - There should be a new line after each key value pair.
But in few cases, in thats different. Here, we are ignoring the new line token passed to parser as that validation is not needed. Ex -  Arrays
arr = [
"hello",
"hello1"
,
"hello2"
]

I see. I guess it should be fine then. Usually syntax tree represents everything including minutiae that user inputs. (useful when formatting, etc)
Anyway since we capture the newline explicitly from the lexer, we need to add NEWLINE as an alternative path for ARRAY_VALUE_END ctx in error handler I think. There could be invalid tokens before the NEWLINE token.
e.g.
[ "abc"  + invalid +
, "ABC" ]

@SupunS please have a look.
+1 for skipping. @xlight05 May be we can create a new issue and address this in a separate PR.
Need to update the error handler for the above change. (when recovering with NUMERICAL_LITERAL ctx)
what does this TODO suppose to mean? I guess we don't need this.
shouldn't we go to recovery with STRING_CONTENT parser rule context?
same comment(#27358 (comment)) valid here also.
Created an issue for this. #27641

Can we have a single key like this?
 [["""fruit"""]]
In this method we go to recovery with KEY_START ctx which allows both TRIPLE_DOUBLE_QUOTE_TOKEN and TRIPLE_SINGLE_QUOTE_TOKEN, but the parsing method does not allow them.
Therefore, for above example parseSingleKey will keep re-parsing again and again.
It seems like we cant reuse same context for multi strings. Addressed this issue by introducing separate tokens for parsing multiline (literal) strings.
single quote token
seems this method is called within both string and literal string. if it is literal string shouldn't we need to go to recovery with LITERAL_STRING_CONTENT?
shall we call this parseTripleSingleQuoteToken? (To be consistence with  parseTripleDoubleQuoteToken below)
we have a long if-else-if ladder which is slower and complex than equivalent switch. Shall we replace?

nodes.bodyText: We have a small problem here. We call parseStringContent in 4 places and depending on the context we need only one kind to be checked here. Here we are heavily depending on the lexer logic. i.e we assume SINGLE_QUOTE_TOKEN is always followed by SINGLE_QUOTE_TOKEN when the string content is empty. We can make parsing independent of lexer logic by having 4 separate methods to parse each.
can use == to check. (it can prevent possible NPE, complie time type safe and faster compared to a method call)
